column4: Guys, i need help trying to install my nvidia display driver - everytime i install it when my system reboots my monitor goes into standby
Sounds like you are using a resolution or something that your monitor can't handle
my monitor handles 1920x1200 and i was at 800x600 when rebooting, and ive tried 1280x1024 also
Maybe it is the refresh rate, horizontal or vertical rates?
I don't know. I always just guess mine with what I think of as conservative values
Choose nvidia (you could choose nv, but what is the point if you are trying to get nvidia working?)
right, what ammount of memory to be used by video card?
You shouldn't have to set it unless it is onboard, and then it depends entirely on the cartd
Don't use DRI, I know that much
I was going to say disable it. But I think the latest driver doesn't actually care
sudo /etc/init.d/gdm start|stop|restart (where | means or) works as well
